alert.note: Alert for Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 1:48PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hot Springs and west central Washakie Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 148 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kirby, or 12 miles north of Thermopolis, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Hot Springs and west central Washakie Counties, including the following locations... Badlands Overlook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
